ygData.subject: Re: Still kinda dense on specialization, sorry.
ygData.msgSnippet: Damn, you re right. Hm. This is suddenly a much tougher choice... I envy those wizards whose obvious choice is evocation! Since buffing is usually done at
ygData.messageBody:
Damn, you're right. Hm. This is suddenly a much tougher choice...
I envy those wizards whose obvious choice is evocation!

Since buffing is usually done at leisure, between battles, speed is not
important, although mana cost is; it's annoying to buff your team and then
have to med for a while, when they're rarin' to go.

Still, it looks like alteration is the the thing to specialize in. Faster,
less-disrupted, lower-mana emergency heals during battle would help my team
more than anything else I can think of.

There are a few other useful alteration spells, like the Root/Enstill
spells, and the Lull/Soothe spells. And all the Cure/Counteract spells, for
poison and disease, are alteration. And the Yaulp series. Still, it's
unfortunate that the most important cleric spells seem to fall into two
different categories, and we can only specialize in one.

== Gilead, 17th level cleric on Fennin Ro

-----Original Message-----
From: I.G <shadowtg1@...>
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Date: Wednesday, June 30, 1999 10:20 AM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Still kinda dense on specialization, sorry.


>From: I.G <shadowtg1@...>

>healing is alteration but buffing is abjuradation.
>
>Jaxim

>>

I
>>can't even specialize until lvl 30, right? By that time ALL my magic
skill
>>levels will be at 150.
>>
>>So if I specialize (I believe alteration IS the healing/buffing one) at
lvl
>>30, what happens? I'm thinking that my alteration will continue to go up,
>>but the other 3 or 4 will suddenly take a 100 level dive back to lvl 50?
>>
>>I'm not bitching, I just haven't decided whether or not I want to do it.
>>Thank god it'll take me a minimum of 2 more months before I get to lvl 30
&
>>apparently have to worry about making that decision. :)
